| A gnome lord:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is a gnome.

* is male.
* can pick up weapons and food.

* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | [monst.c#line1457](/wiki/Monst.c#line1457 "Monst.c") |

A **gnome lord**, G, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. A gnome lord is a slightly stronger type of [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_class\) "Gnome (monster class)"), and is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") to his kind.

Like standard [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster\) "Gnome (monster)"), a gnome lord has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and can be seen with infravision, and hostile gnome lords will collect items that they can use. A gnome lord has a single weapon attack.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Gnome lords are known as **gnome leaders**, with "lord" and "lady" being gendered titles.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [1.1 Starting inventory](#Starting_inventory)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated gnome lords are always peaceful towards [gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") and [dwarvish](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") [heroes](/wiki/Hero "Hero"), and will be hostile towards the other playable races. A gnome can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a gnome lord, and a gnome lord can grow up into a [gnome king](/wiki/Gnome_king "Gnome king").

A gnome lord is generated on each of the filler levels in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") at level creation, and three each are generated in The Gnome King's Wine Cellar and The Mimic of the Mines maps of [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End"). For a dwarvish or gnomish character, two-thirds of the gnomes and other peaceful monsters will instead be replaced with random monsters.

Gnome lords may appear among the hostile G that generate in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room"), as well the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

A gnome will grow up into a gnome leader of the appropriate gender, rather than always becoming a male gnome lord regardless of gender.

### Starting inventory

Gnome lords are eligible for [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item"), and [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item").

A gnome lord placed at level creation has a chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a single [candle](/wiki/Candle "Candle"): the chance is 1⁄20 if he is in the Gnomish Mines, and 1⁄60 otherwise.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) The candle has a 3⁄4 chance of being tallow and a 1⁄4 chance of being wax, and will be lit if the gnome is generated in a dark area.

Gnome lords that are not generated on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level") have a 5⁄12 chance of being generated with one of the default weapon sets, with an equal probability of each: 3-14 [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), a [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow") and 3-14 [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt"), a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow") and 3-14 [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow"), a stack of 3-5 [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), or an [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys").[\[3\]](#cite_note-default-3)

## Strategy

Gnome lords are faster and deal slightly more damage than regular gnomes, but are otherwise similar: they are still strong enough that an early hero may not be able to reliably kill them in one hit, and prolonged fights in open areas like the Gnomish Mines can become perilous as a result. The ranged weapons gnomes often generate with also makes fighting in the open ill-advised, especially if there are other gnomes around to shoot at you or pelt you with projectiles; they can also use [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand"), [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") and other items against you.

Escape items or ranged attacks of your own can help defend against oncoming gnome lords - the terrain of the Gnomish Mines allows for strategic baiting of monsters into melee range, and leading gnome lords into corridors or around corners can help you isolate them from their allies. Gnome lords respect [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"), but will still use any ranged attacks at their disposal when fleeing. [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") are not remotely required, but characters that happen upon a source early are protected from worst-case scenarios involving gnomes and certain surprise wands or [tools](/wiki/Tool "Tool").

## History

The gnome lord first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

Some variants make adjustments so that female counterparts to the gnome lord are properly named and generated.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), if the player is a gnome or a dwarf, most peaceful gnome lords in the Gnomish Mines are replaced with hostile [gnome mummies](/wiki/Gnome_mummies "Gnome mummies") at level creation with the exception of [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones"), ensuring that they will have to deal with hostile monsters like other races.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), female gnomes grow up into [gnome ladies](/wiki/Gnome_lady_\(dNetHack\) "Gnome lady (dNetHack)"), which are distinct monsters from gnome lords rather than simple female counterparts.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the monster is known as a **gnome leader**.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the monster is referred to as a **gnome noble**.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the monster is also known as a gnome noble as in EvilHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

... And then a gnome came by, carrying a bundle, an old fellow three times as large as an imp and wearing clothes of a sort, especially a hat. And he was clearly just as frightened as the imps though he could not go so fast. Ramon Alonzo saw that there must be some great trouble that was vexing magical things; and, since gnomes speak the language of men, and will answer if spoken to gently, he raised his hat, and asked of the gnome his name. The gnome did not stop his hasty shuffle a moment as he answered 'Alaraba' and grabbed the rim of his hat but forgot to doff it.  
'What is the trouble, Alaraba?' said Ramon Alonzo.  
'White magic. Run!' said the gnome ..  
                        \[ The Charwoman's Shadow, by Lord Dunsany ]  
   
"Muggles have garden gnomes, too, you know," Harry told Ron as they crossed the lawn.  
"Yeah, I've seen those things they think are gnomes," said Ron, bent double with his head in a peony bush, "like fat little Santa Clauses with fishing rods..."  
There was a violent scuffling noise, the peony bush shuddered, and Ron straightened up. "This is a gnome," he said grimly.  
"Geroff me! Gerroff me!" squealed the gnome.  
It was certainly nothing like Santa Claus. It was small and leathery looking, with a large, knobby, bald head exactly like a potato. Ron held it at arm's length as it kicked out at him with its horny little feet; he grasped it around the ankles and turned it upside down.

\[ Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, by J. K. Rowling ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mkroom.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 755](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkroom.c#L755)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 777](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L777)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-default_3-0) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 512](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L512): *Default set of cases for monster weapon generation*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [sp\_lev.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 854](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/sp_lev.c#line854 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/sp lev.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Gnome lord

From NetHackWiki

G gnome lord
Difficulty 4
Attacks Weapon 1d8
G gnome lord
Difficulty 4
Attacks

Weapon 1d8

Base level 3
Base experience 33
Speed 8
Base AC 10
Base MR 4
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 700
Nutritional value 120
Size Small
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A gnome lord:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is a gnome.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is male.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line1457

A gnome lord, G, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. A gnome lord is a slightly stronger type of gnome, and is a lord to his kind.

Like standard gnomes, a gnome lord has infravision and can be seen with infravision, and hostile gnome lords will collect items that they can use. A gnome lord has a single weapon attack.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Gnome lords are known as gnome leaders, with "lord" and "lady" being gendered titles.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
    • 1.1 Starting inventory
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 xNetHack
    • 4.4 EvilHack
    • 4.5 Hack'EM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly generated gnome lords are always peaceful towards gnomish and dwarvish heroes, and will be hostile towards the other playable races. A gnome can grow up into a gnome lord, and a gnome lord can grow up into a gnome king.

A gnome lord is generated on each of the filler levels in the Gnomish Mines at level creation, and three each are generated in The Gnome King's Wine Cellar and The Mimic of the Mines maps of Mines' End. For a dwarvish or gnomish character, two-thirds of the gnomes and other peaceful monsters will instead be replaced with random monsters.

Gnome lords may appear among the hostile G that generate in throne rooms, as well the monsters randomly generated by looting a throne while confused and carrying gold (provided there is no chest on the level).[1]

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

A gnome will grow up into a gnome leader of the appropriate gender, rather than always becoming a male gnome lord regardless of gender.

Starting inventory

Gnome lords are eligible for offensive items, defensive items, and miscellaneous items.

A gnome lord placed at level creation has a chance of being generated with a single candle: the chance is 1⁄20 if he is in the Gnomish Mines, and 1⁄60 otherwise.[2] The candle has a 3⁄4 chance of being tallow and a 1⁄4 chance of being wax, and will be lit if the gnome is generated in a dark area.

Gnome lords that are not generated on the Rogue level have a 5⁄12 chance of being generated with one of the default weapon sets, with an equal probability of each: 3-14 darts, a crossbow and 3-14 crossbow bolts, a bow and 3-14 arrows, a stack of 3-5 daggers, or an aklys.[3]

Strategy

Gnome lords are faster and deal slightly more damage than regular gnomes, but are otherwise similar: they are still strong enough that an early hero may not be able to reliably kill them in one hit, and prolonged fights in open areas like the Gnomish Mines can become perilous as a result. The ranged weapons gnomes often generate with also makes fighting in the open ill-advised, especially if there are other gnomes around to shoot at you or pelt you with projectiles; they can also use wands, scrolls and other items against you.

Escape items or ranged attacks of your own can help defend against oncoming gnome lords - the terrain of the Gnomish Mines allows for strategic baiting of monsters into melee range, and leading gnome lords into corridors or around corners can help you isolate them from their allies. Gnome lords respect Elbereth, but will still use any ranged attacks at their disposal when fleeing. Magic resistance and reflection are not remotely required, but characters that happen upon a source early are protected from worst-case scenarios involving gnomes and certain surprise wands or tools.

History

The gnome lord first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

Some variants make adjustments so that female counterparts to the gnome lord are properly named and generated.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, if the player is a gnome or a dwarf, most peaceful gnome lords in the Gnomish Mines are replaced with hostile gnome mummies at level creation with the exception of bones, ensuring that they will have to deal with hostile monsters like other races.[4]

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, female gnomes grow up into gnome ladies, which are distinct monsters from gnome lords rather than simple female counterparts.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the monster is known as a gnome leader.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the monster is referred to as a gnome noble.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, the monster is also known as a gnome noble as in EvilHack.

Encyclopedia entry

... And then a gnome came by, carrying a bundle, an old fellow three times as large as an imp and wearing clothes of a sort, especially a hat. And he was clearly just as frightened as the imps though he could not go so fast. Ramon Alonzo saw that there must be some great trouble that was vexing magical things; and, since gnomes speak the language of men, and will answer if spoken to gently, he raised his hat, and asked of the gnome his name. The gnome did not stop his hasty shuffle a moment as he answered 'Alaraba' and grabbed the rim of his hat but forgot to doff it.
'What is the trouble, Alaraba?' said Ramon Alonzo.
'White magic. Run!' said the gnome ..
                        [ The Charwoman's Shadow, by Lord Dunsany ]
 
"Muggles have garden gnomes, too, you know," Harry told Ron as they crossed the lawn.
"Yeah, I've seen those things they think are gnomes," said Ron, bent double with his head in a peony bush, "like fat little Santa Clauses with fishing rods..."
There was a violent scuffling noise, the peony bush shuddered, and Ron straightened up. "This is a gnome," he said grimly.
"Geroff me! Gerroff me!" squealed the gnome.
It was certainly nothing like Santa Claus. It was small and leathery looking, with a large, knobby, bald head exactly like a potato. Ron held it at arm's length as it kicked out at him with its horny little feet; he grasped it around the ankles and turned it upside down.

[ Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, by J. K. Rowling ]

A '''gnome lord''', {{monsym|gnome lord}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. A gnome lord is a slightly stronger type of [[Gnome (monster class)|gnome]], and is a [[M2 LORD|lord]] to his kind.

Like standard [[Gnome (monster)|gnomes]], a gnome lord has [[infravision]] and can be seen with infravision, and hostile gnome lords will collect items that they can use. A gnome lord has a single weapon attack.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Gnome lords are known as '''gnome leaders''', with "lord" and "lady" being gendered titles.}}

==Generation==
Randomly generated gnome lords are always peaceful towards [[Gnome (starting race)|gnomish]] and [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarvish]] [[hero]]es, and will be hostile towards the other playable races. A gnome can [[grow up]] into a gnome lord, and a gnome lord can grow up into a [[gnome king]].

A gnome lord is generated on each of the filler levels in the [[Gnomish Mines]] at level creation, and three each are generated in The Gnome King's Wine Cellar and The Mimic of the Mines maps of [[Mines' End]]. For a dwarvish or gnomish character, two-thirds of the gnomes and other peaceful monsters will instead be replaced with random monsters.

Gnome lords may appear among the hostile {{white|G}} that generate in [[throne room]]s, as well the monsters randomly generated by [[looting]] a [[throne]] while [[confused]] and carrying gold (provided there is no [[chest]] on the level).{{refsrc|src/mkroom.c|755|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

{{upcoming|3.7.0|A gnome will grow up into a gnome leader of the appropriate gender, rather than always becoming a male gnome lord regardless of gender.}}

===Starting inventory===
Gnome lords are eligible for [[offensive item]]s, [[defensive item]]s, and [[miscellaneous item]]s. 

A gnome lord placed at level creation has a chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a single [[candle]]: the chance is {{frac|20}} if he is in the Gnomish Mines, and {{frac|60}} otherwise.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|777|nethack=3.6.7}} The candle has a {{frac|3|4}} chance of being tallow and a {{frac|4}} chance of being wax, and will be lit if the gnome is generated in a dark area.

Gnome lords that are not generated on the [[Rogue level]] have a {{frac|5|12}} chance of being generated with one of the default weapon sets, with an equal probability of each: 3-14 [[dart]]s, a [[crossbow]] and 3-14 [[crossbow bolt]]s, a [[bow]] and 3-14 [[arrow]]s, a stack of 3-5 [[dagger]]s, or an [[aklys]].{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|512|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name="default"|comment=Default set of cases for monster weapon generation}}

==Strategy==
Gnome lords are faster and deal slightly more damage than regular gnomes, but are otherwise similar: they are still strong enough that an early hero may not be able to reliably kill them in one hit, and prolonged fights in open areas like the Gnomish Mines can become perilous as a result. The ranged weapons gnomes often generate with also makes fighting in the open ill-advised, especially if there are other gnomes around to shoot at you or pelt you with projectiles; they can also use [[wand]]s, [[scroll]]s and other items against you.

Escape items or ranged attacks of your own can help defend against oncoming gnome lords - the terrain of the Gnomish Mines allows for strategic baiting of monsters into melee range, and leading gnome lords into corridors or around corners can help you isolate them from their allies. Gnome lords respect [[Elbereth]], but will still use any ranged attacks at their disposal when fleeing. [[Magic resistance]] and [[reflection]] are not remotely required, but characters that happen upon a source early are protected from worst-case scenarios involving gnomes and certain surprise wands or [[tool]]s.

==History==
The gnome lord first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
Some variants make adjustments so that female counterparts to the gnome lord are properly named and generated.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], if the player is a gnome or a dwarf, most peaceful gnome lords in the Gnomish Mines are replaced with hostile [[gnome mummies]] at level creation with the exception of [[bones]], ensuring that they will have to deal with hostile monsters like other races.{{refsrc|sp_lev.c|854|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], female gnomes grow up into [[Gnome lady (dNetHack)|gnome ladies]], which are distinct monsters from gnome lords rather than simple female counterparts.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], the monster is known as a '''gnome leader'''.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the monster is referred to as a '''gnome noble'''.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], the monster is also known as a gnome noble as in EvilHack.

==Encyclopedia entry==

...  And then a gnome came by, carrying a bundle, an old fellow three times as large as an imp and wearing clothes of a sort, especially a hat.  And he was clearly just as frightened as the imps though he could not go so fast.  Ramon Alonzo saw that there must be some great trouble that was vexing magical things; and, since gnomes speak the language of men, and will answer if spoken to gently, he raised his hat, and asked of the gnome his name.  The gnome did not stop his hasty shuffle a moment as he answered 'Alaraba' and grabbed the rim of his hat but forgot to doff it.
'What is the trouble, Alaraba?'  said Ramon Alonzo.
'White magic.  Run!'  said the gnome ..
                        [ The Charwoman's Shadow, by Lord Dunsany ]
 
"Muggles have garden gnomes, too, you know," Harry told Ron as they crossed the lawn.
"Yeah, I've seen those things they think are gnomes," said Ron, bent double with his head in a peony bush, "like fat little Santa Clauses with fishing rods..."
There was a violent scuffling noise, the peony bush shuddered, and Ron straightened up.  "This is a gnome," he said grimly.
"Geroff me! Gerroff me!" squealed the gnome.
It was certainly nothing like Santa Claus.  It was small and leathery looking, with a large, knobby, bald head exactly like a potato.  Ron held it at arm's length as it kicked out at him with its horny little feet; he grasped it around the ankles and turned it upside down.
|[ Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, by J. K. Rowling ]
